duties_responsibilities.duty: Evaluate and manage invention disclosures, develop licensing strategies, and conduct outreach to successfully commercialize University-owned intellectual property.
Maintain a close working relationship with other OTM and campus staff to fulfill federal compliance, IP protection, and related needs.
Develop and manage strong relationships with faculty inventors and corporate representatives to build a pipeline of disclosures and business development opportunities.
Provide specialized advice and counsel on technology commercialization, including disclosing inventions, screening and evaluation, intellectual property, and licensing.
Perform licensing and marketing responsibilities, including evaluating and screening disclosures, identifying and qualifying licensees, and drafting business terms for license agreements.
Develop and deliver an annual Action Plan to maintain effective relationships with inventors and licensees for marketing of technologies.
Train and mentor Associate Technology Managers and other support staff as needed.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in related field. Master's or professional degree strongly preferred. Graduate or undergraduate coursework in intellectual property law, or work experience related to analyzing, securing, and licensing intellectual property.
